description: Dive into "Discovering Johor Bahru's Hidden Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Discovering Johor Bahru's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Danga Bay Park is a popular waterfront complex in Johor Bahru, attracting both locals and tourists. The area offers a variety of dining options, shops, and a small theme park with carnival-style rides and fun fair games. At night, the bay area comes alive with illuminated lights. Visitors can also enjoy the Danga World Petting Zoo and Danga World Theme Park within the complex.

sources.snippet: Danga Bay is a waterfront complex that has a range of dining and lifestyle attractions. It is a very popular spot for tourists in Johor Bahru as it is also the home of the Danga World Petting Zoo which is smaller than the main zoo in Johor but has animal shows where younger visitors can get up close to the animals. Danga World Theme Park is also located in the Danga Bay Complex and has around 20 rides such as a scenic Ferris wheel and spinning tea cups.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Johor Bahru (Malaysia)

sources.snippet: With rides as cheap as RM2 (~S$0.62), the retro Danga World Theme Park is one of the best places to have fun with friends and family!. Scream your heart out on the swinging pirate ship that swings left and right high up in the air. Here, you can also drive around on some retro bumper cars and playfully collide cars with other visitors.
sources.shortName: 15 New Things to Do in Johor Bahru on Your Next Weekend Trip

places.name: Danga Bay Park

reviews.text:
Rides are affordable and kids are happy. Crowed on Fri_sun.

The entrance is all the way back, on the left near the toilet..

Car park spaces are limited too.
Don't any how park, there are police on motorbike giving out fines.

A retro theme park for a date promises a nostalgic and warm ambiance, featuring classic attractions like the pirate ship ride and carousel.

The vintage charm extends to game booths adorned with old, slightly weathered toys, adding a unique touch to the atmosphere. While enjoying the allure of yesteryear, it's advisable to bring insect repellent to ward off mosquitoes and make your experience more comfortable.

We went on weekdays‚Ä¶. Not too crowded had lots of fun. The rides was good some are family rides and the counter games was good too. My kids enjoyed the fun‚Ä¶ Especially on the toy car rental. Malay food seafood Bistro and some counter food stalls are available.

places.address: Skudai Hwy, Danga Bay, 80200 Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: This park is perfect for a family day out as it has a variety of activities and attractions suitable for all ages, including a children's play area. There are also many food stalls selling local snacks, so you can fuel up before exploring the rest of the park.
places.name: Johor Bahru City Council City Forest

reviews.text: Gorgeous forest reserve and park in the middle of the city, not far from downtown. Beautiful place to walk and enjoy the nature and greenery, lakes, trees, swamps, playgrounds, orchids, all peaceful and well maintained. Perfect for picnic and family time.
The park is huge, it has parkpur facilities. Sometimes the ponds have stinky smell. Suggest to install some water filters to remove the smell and clean the ponds regularly

Currently undergoing upgrading. All the playground and water play cannot use.

Lots of mosquitoes. Better bring insect repellent.

Overall, quiet place to walk. There is an orchid garden in the middle of the mini forest.

places.address: Jalan Tasek Utara, Geylang Bahru, 80100 Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: A wonderful hiking area located in the heart of the rainforest, Blue Lagoon Seri Alam offers stunning waterfalls, dense jungles and birdlife galore. The trails are well signposted and provide a perfect opportunity to get up close and personal with nature.

sources.snippet: Most of us go to JB for massage and manicure but if you have a penchant for the great outdoors, take a trip to Seri Alam Blue Lake, a 20-minute drive from JB CIQ. Immerse yourself in nature with a 2-hour trail that starts from Seri Alam Jungle Park. You‚Äôll arrive at an elevated lookout with panoramic vistas of quarry. Image credit: @aleahssn via Instagram
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal - Singapore's Leading Travel and Lifestyle Portal
sources.shortName: 11 Free Things To Do In JB For Singaporeans In 2024

places.name: Blue Lake Seri Alam

reviews.text: One of the best places to do hiking in JB area, many wonderful trails to explore here, easy to intense trails available here‚Ä¶..best to start your day here
We hike 11km around the lagoon. Recommended for new hikers too. A few climbs but easy with ropes. Many IG spots. The green corridor is pretty too. We shared the paths with many mountain bikes.

It's an okay hiking area - probably a disused old quarry, and the top there is a viewpoint and the lake is rather pretty.  follow your route through Strava.  it's not unsafe and there is a path, just that it's a bit of a pity that the trees in the plantation nearby are now felled and the land is barren.

places.address: To Blue Lake, 81750 Masai, Johor, Malaysia

sources.snippet: At 650 meters high, it‚Äôs more of a push than walking around Sireh Park or Bukit Tiz, but it‚Äôs not a massive mountain.
sources.shortName: The Best Family Friendly Attractions In Johor Bahru!

places.name: SIREH Park

reviews.text: If you walk beyond the inner lake (not the lake at parking area), beyond the coffee place, you could end up walking 10km long. There are parts of the park that sound like a real jungle. There are parts of steep climbs as well. But the track is shared with cycling so just be careful.

Sireh Park ‚Äì Great Spot for Beginner Hikers

If you're an easy hiker or just starting out, Sireh Park is a nice place to explore. Parking is available along the road.

For my first trail, I hiked to the Raptor Nest. The path is well-covered with large rocks, making it easy to walk and beginner-friendly. Along the way, there's a small river with a jetty, kayak area, and a little caf√© where you can enjoy a cup of coffee or even a Maggi cup. It's a great spot to rest and take in the scenery.

After recharging, you can continue on to the next hill within Sireh Park. I started my hike around 8:00 AM and got back to the parking area by 10:00 AM. Be ready to sweat-it was a good workout!

Total distance: approx. 4.89 km
Calories burned: approx. 1251 kcal

This park is really huge!
Unfortunately, it was raining during my visit, so I didn't go hiking.
Instead, I spent some time walking around the park area.
It was nice to see the ducks, geese, and even turkey wandering around.

The atmosphere is peaceful and relaxing, with not too many people around, which makes it a great spot to just slow down and enjoy nature.

The only downside is that there are a lot of mosquitoes, so please bring mosquito repellent if you want to visit!!

places.address: Sireh Park, Jalan Nusa Idaman, Nusa Idaman, 79100 Iskandar Puteri, Johor, Malaysia

sources.snippet: This family-friendly park is the perfect one-stop destination for some sporty family fun. Hutan Bandar Recreational Park has everything ‚Äì from children‚Äô s playgrounds and swimming pools to keep the little ones entertained, to a youth hub with rock climbing facilities and skate parks. There‚Äôs also ample space to set up picnics with the fam.
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal - Singapore's Leading Travel and Lifestyle Portal
sources.shortName: 11 Free Things To Do In JB For Singaporeans In 2024

sources.snippet: If you are in town with your kids, you have to visit the Hutan Bandar Recreational Park Johor !. It was opened in the year 1993 and is spread across an area of 32 hectares. Hutan Bandar means ‚Äòforest within a city‚Äô and this park lives upto its name.

If you find yourself in Central JB, Hutan Bandar is a great place to take the kids for a picnic lunch and enjoy being in nature. We saw one or two huge lizards in the water there and also squirrels scurrying around the trees.
sources.shortName: The Best Family Friendly Attractions In Johor Bahru!

places.name: The Kelulut Park, Hutan Bandar Johor Bahru

reviews.text: The best place to know and get kelulut honey

places.address: Lot 4485, Jalan Tasek Utara, Hutan Bandar MBJB, 80200 Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Tasik Biru Kangkar Pulai is a stunning, oasis-like lake with an unbelievable shade of blue that seems almost otherworldly. Once a part of a copper mine, the lake's cobalt hue is a result of sunlight interacting with copper sulphate in the ground. While it's popular among Instagrammers for its picturesque beauty, reaching the lake requires a two-hour hike through a lush forest from the nearest road.

sources.snippet: Despite the kinda rough mountain road, Tasik Biru, otherwise Blue Lake, in Kangkar Pulai is guaranteed to sweep your tiredness away!. Location: Persiaran Bandar Baru Kangkar Pulai Fasa 3b, Bandar Baru Kangkar Pulai, Johor Bahru, Johor
sources.shortName: 9 Snap-Worthy Places You Can Visit for Free in Johor Bahru

places.name: Tasik Biru Kangkar Pulai

reviews.text: Easy climb but beautiful view. Too bad the construction is going on

Very good experience for basic hikers. Not so difficult to hike. But especially be careful when raining seasons, it's slippery. Dot miss out your photography on the peak. The lake awesome in blue colour and beautiful views. Refresh your day there. Peace of minds. Hope you'll enjoy too.üëçüèΩ‚úåüèΩ

places.address: HHFG+JV, Bandar Baru Kangkar Pulai, 81110 JOHOR, Johor Darul Ta'zim, Malaysia
